Event.name: Protest
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Protester</fen> (or <fen>Protester</fen>s) expresses a strong opinion either in support of or against an <fen>Issue</fen>, or the <fen>Action</fen>(s) of a <fen>Side</fen> which relate to the <fen>Issue</fen>. The public expression of support or opposition often involves multiple <fen>Protester</fen>s participating in an orginized assembly in a public area.
<ex><fex name="pro">Several hundred Tibetans</fex>, already worried by inflation, took to the streets to <t>protest</t> <fex name="Action">at the new measures</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Fourteen people were killed in the <t>demonstration</t> <fex name="Issue">for the unemployed</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Protester
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The individual (or individuals) who holds an opinion on an Issue or Side.
<ex>On 8 May a <fex name="pro">student</fex> <t>demonstration</t> was attended by a large number of workers.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Issue
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The matter, usually concerning a course of action, which the <fen>Protester</fen> has an positive or negative opinion about.
<ex>Hundreds gathered this afternoon to <t>demonsrate</t> <fex name="Issue">for women's rights</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Side
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The party or individual (generally associated with a particular position on an <fen>Issue</fen>) that the <fen>Protester</fen> sides with.
<ex>Violent <t>protests</t> <fex name="sid">against the government</fex> are sure to break out.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Protester</fen> supports or opposes something, or expresses views on the <fen>Issue</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The time period during which the Protesters express their opinions.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> is a proposition denoting a state of affairs from which the <fen>Protester</fen>'s expressing his or her views on the <fen>Issue</fen> logically follows.</def-root>

Arg.name: Action
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An action taken by a Side or a view that the Side takes on an issue which the <fen>Protester</fen> either supports or opposes.
<ex>Several hundred Tibetans, already worried by inflation, took to the streets to <t>protest</t> <fex name="Action">at the new measures</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Descriptor
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the person or element that is protesting.</def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the a Protest which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Protester that affect the action (reluctantly, meekly).</def-root>

Arg.name: Concessive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause. </def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location where the <fen>Protester</fen> takes <fen>Side</fen>s on an <fen>Issue</fen> .</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The length of time of the protest.
<ex>The <fex name="dur">month-long</fex> <t>protest</t> is slowly losing momentum.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The frequency with which the protest occurs.
<ex>Police have grown increasingly frustrated at the <fex name="fre">nightly</fex> <t>demonstrations</t>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: demonstration.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: public display and expression of support of or opposition to an issue.

lexUnit.name: demonstrate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: participate in a gathering to express opinions regarding an issue.

lexUnit.name: protest.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a public display to support or oppose an idea or take a stance on an issue.

lexUnit.name: protest.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: display, often in a group, support or opposition towards an idea or proposal.

lexUnit.name: protester.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who demonstrates their support or opposition to an idea.
